comments: Discriminant -23.Also primes of the form x^2+xy+6y^2. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 02 2014Also primes of the form x^2-xy+6y^2 with x and y nonnegative. - _T. D. Noe_, May 07 2005Primes p such that X^3-X+1 is split modulo p. E.g. X^3-X+1=(X-33)(X-40)(X-94) modulo 167. - Julien Freslon (julien.freslon(AT)wanadoo.fr), Feb 24 2007If x>0, then tau(p) = 2 mod 23 - comment from _Jud McCranie_.
references: Lure of the Integers, Joe Roberts, "Integer 23 - the Tau function".
David A. Cox, "Primes of the Form x^2 + n y^2", Wiley, 1989.
links: T. D. Noe and Ray Chandler, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 [First 1000 terms from T. D. Noe]
N. J. A. Sloane et al., Binary Quadratic Forms and OEIS (Index to related sequences, programs, references)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
